revised_title: Predation-Based Selective Pressures and the Evolution of Bird Coloration
tldr: This study analyzes the coloration of 616 bird species in the Western Palaearctic region using multiple regression to understand the evolution of bird coloration. The research finds that bird coloration has evolved primarily in response to predation-based selective pressures rather than sexual selection. The unprofitable prey model accounts for most of the variation in bird coloration, while sexual dimorphism and polygamy are more likely explained by predation risk than sexual pressures.
